meanings.definition: Concerned only with the obvious or apparent
meanings.sent1: She only had a superficial understanding of the topic.
meanings.sent2: His superficial compliments didn't fool anyone.
meanings.sent3: The detective's superficial investigation missed crucial clues.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as superficial as a thin layer of ice.
meanings.sent5: The superficial scratch on the car was actually deep and costly to repair.

meanings.sent1: His superficial jokes always made us laugh.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot was so superficial, it was forgettable.
meanings.sent3: The superficial excuse for being late was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: Her superficial interest in the project was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The superficial conversation left them feeling empty and unsatisfied.

meanings.definition: Situated or occurring on the surface
meanings.sent1: The superficial layer of paint was peeling off.
meanings.sent2: The superficial wound required only a bandage.
meanings.sent3: The superficial design on the cake was eye-catching.
meanings.sent4: His superficial charm was appealing at first glance.
meanings.sent5: The superficial scratches on the table were easily fixed with a polish.
